avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack is considered stable after warm weather recently. Little snow is left in the mountains but small wet avalanches are possible high in the mountains inland.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has settled well after freeze-thaw cycles and the snowpack is quite stable. Snow profile from Hengill on April 25th showed an isothermal, stable snow pack. Now there is little snow left in the mountains altough small sloughs may release in warm weather.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snow pack is generally considered stable and isothermal after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may persist in the mountains in the East fjords. Large natural avalanches have been falling after the warming started in the North of Iceland, suggesting a weaknes may still be active although freeze thaw cycles and mild weather continue to strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability is still present in the snowpack in the North and the East but diurnal fluctuations should strengthen the snowpack in the next days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar suðlægar áttir og lítilsháttar skúrir á fimmtudag og föstudag. Hiti almennt yfir frostmarki til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Skier triggered loose snow avalanche last week in Seljalandsdalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Skier triggered loose snow avalanche last week in Seljalandsdalur. Wet avalanches could occur af afternoon warming

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack is likely becoming rather homogenous after freeze-thaw cycles. A snowpit from Steiniðjugil on April 23 showed a rather homogenous and isothermal snowpack. Wet sluffs could occur in afternoon warming in slopes facing the sun.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snow pack is generally considered stable and isothermal after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may persist in the mountains in the East fjords. Large natural avalanches have been falling after the warming started in the North of Iceland, suggesting a weaknes may still be active although freeze thaw cycles and mild weather continue to strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability is still present in the snowpack in the North and the East but diurnal fluctuations should strengthen the snowpack in the next days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar úrkoma í suðlægum áttum fram að helgi, mest rigning til fjalla. Áframhaldandi dægusveiflur í hita.

avalancheActivity.comment: Surface movement is widely seen in the region due to sun exposure and a large slab avalanche fell in Flókadalur during the weekend. A large wet loose avalanche fell in Hestskarð last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided widely in thaw from a week ago, but less thaw occurred in high elevations where snow is layered and weaknesses persist. Snow is affected by diurnal temperature fluctuations and solar radiation, especially in S facing aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thaw and warming started last week and snow has subsided and stiffened somewhat, but considerable snow remains high in the mountains and weak layer can persist at high elevations. A snowpit from Burstabrekkudalur last week gave CT11RP but ECTX on a weak layer by an ice layer on top of old firn. Warm temperatures continue during the day and solar radiation affects the top layers of the snow with chance of wet avalanches, especially in S facing aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snow pack is generally considered stable and isothermal after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may persist in the mountains in the East fjords. Large natural avalanches have been falling after the warming started in the North of Iceland, suggesting a weaknes may still be active although freeze thaw cycles and mild weather continue to strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability is still present in the snowpack in the North and the East but diurnal fluctuations should strengthen the snowpack in the next days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður næstu daga en lítilsháttar úrkoma á föstudag. Dægursveiflur í hitastigi og hlýindi í kortunum.

avalancheActivity.comment: Large loose avalanches released on Friday in Hólmatindur. Avalanches released during thaw last weekend, natural and human triggered.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs may be found in the mountains after snow showers on Saturday. Underlying snowpack is considered stable after thaw and diurnal temperature fluctuations this week.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs may be present in southerly aspects during snow showers on Saturday. There is a significant amount of snow in the mountains but a lot of snow melt in the lower elevations this week. The snow pack is considered stable after diurnal temperature fluctuations.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snow pack is generally considered stable and isothermal after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may persist in the mountains in the East fjords. Large natural avalanches have been falling after the warming started in the North of Iceland, suggesting a weaknes may still be active although freeze thaw cycles and mild weather continue to strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability is still present in the snowpack in the North and the East but diurnal fluctuations should strengthen the snowpack in the next days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður næstu daga og áframhaldandi hlýindi. Lítilsháttar snjókoma efst til fjalla á fimmtudag en rigning á föstudag.
